website_summaries.verdict: Battery-powered projector with 3-hour run time that's smart to take with you when camping.
pros: Very small projector that will fit in the palm of your hand and only weighs 0.75 pounds
Short minimum throw ratio of 1.1, making for a good performance in this price point
Offers a maximum projection size of 100 inches, a great performance level for such a small projector
cons: Only includes a maximum ratio of 854x480

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for a Lumo Play interactive floor installation.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this projector in my Lumo Play interactive floor installation for almost 4 years, and it still works great! Surprisingly bright and durable, and easy to set up. I use a security camera mount on a tripod to set it up when I'm travelling. This is the projector I recommend the most for home and portable interactive floor games.
customer_reviews.author: Lumo Interactive

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Lots of bad reviews on this product and i don't see why. This product came with three cables plus the power cord. Picture quality is great if you know to use the focus knob on the side of the unit. Sound is good for how small the unit is. Picture is clear in lighted rooms with even small print. It works with my Iphone 5 with no problems with the correct cable bought from amazon. Just Plug and play. Unlike other reviews i haven't had any issues with the product. I would recommend to everyone if your looking for a awesome projector at a good price this is it. I use my for a non-profit group for seminars and more.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Incompatibility cramps its style
customer_reviews.text: It projects better than expected even in a semi-lit room...just would be great if I could get it to work with either my main laptop (ironically, an Asus Zenbook Prime UX31A Series) or my Samsung Galaxy 4. I had misread the discription and thought it came with an HDMI/mini-HDMI cable. The MHL adaptors are hard to find, and didn't come with the projector (nor the ASUS laptop or my Samsung phone). Might be returning this due to the adaptor issue. ASUS failed in not providing another connection. Really - how much would it be for ASUS to include an extra connector? Or at least recommend the purchase of the connector with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Had this for three years and still really like it. I have only 1 and a half complaints: 1) It is dimmer when on battery. I bought this to watch occasional movies in my small condo with minimal setup and clutter. I still store it in the coffee table drawer, but there's set up required and then a cord I have to step over. 1/2) You need a very dark room for viewing. My place is pretty dark. so I can watch in the day, but my boyfriend's apartment is too bright even with all blinds closed. Also it's hard to multitask without light. Makes it hard to eat and watch, for instance. I'd still recommend it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Torrey

customer_reviews.title: Small Footprint at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding, almost pocket size projector. Super fast delivery. I'm using this with my VonHaus 80" black projector screen and the Ravelli APLT4 61-inch tripod. The Asus unit is approximately 80" from screen, and approximately 44" up from ground to fill the VonHaus with video. I'm able to leave my side lamp on and it not interfere with brightness from the unit. The on-board sound works fine for a cozy quite environment. I'm using an HDMI cable to my PC where sound is abundant. Real-time battery life is around a movie and a half. Charges fast. I also use a blue-tooth transmitter when I go portable to send sound to an amplified device. Small footprint, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I chose this projector and this little guy did not disappoint!! I've taken this camping
customer_reviews.text: After some little research and product comparison, I chose this projector and this little guy did not disappoint!! I've taken this camping, put it up for backyard for movie night and it has been a huge hit with my friends and kids. Is it going to be the best quality picture? No, it a small little projector that has exceeded my expectation greatly tho. I also bought this screenand it makes throwing impromptu movie night really easy.

The focus knob should be more popped out since its small I had a hard time turning the focus knob. Another issue is I'm not able to charge my phone since it's being used. I like the auto shutoff. Not bad but definately coukd have been better.

customer_reviews.title: We projected onto the wall and the picture was amazing using the HDMI cable and the Apple Lightning adapter ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading and reading and reading.............you get the idea, I finally settled on this projector for my husband who constantly talked about wanting to watch movies outside at our home. We use IPhones so I was sure to purchase the lightning adapter so that we had no issues when it arrived as far as connectivity goes. Our first movie was Hotel Transylvania while lying in bed with our seven year old granddaughter. We projected onto the wall and the picture was amazing using the HDMI cable and the Apple Lightning adapter all from the IPhone. We also have a Roku stick that we plan to use. We are looking forward to making memories!

I use it in a small bedroom and am able to project the picture to sizes much larger than any size smart tv that one would place in such a room.

product_meta.title: ASUS S1 Portable Mini Projector HDMI/MHL with Speakers| Ultra-short throw | Up to 3 hours Battery | Power Bank | 2 Years Warranty
product_meta.description: Style:200 LumensA palm-sized projector weighing only 0.75lbs at a height of 1.18-inches, the ASUS S1 LED projector features a built-in rechargeable battery that provides up to 3 hours of projection time that can also be used to charge mobile devices over USB. The S1 has a 1.1:1 short-throw lens that projects a 41-inches diagonal image at a distance of one meter. Housed in an aluminum chassis with a sleek concentric-circle finish, and features an HDMI/MHL port, a USB port (for charging) and an ASUS Sonic Master-enhanced speaker, making the S1 the perfect sidekick for both professional and personal projection.
feature_bullets: Built-in 6,000 mAh rechargeable battery delivers up to 3-hour projection time and doubles as a power bank to charge your mobile devices
Advanced DLP Technology with 30,000-hour LED lifespan, 200 lumens brightness, 854x480 native resolution and big screen size up to 100 inches (in low-light conditions)
Palm-sized and .75 pounds lightweight for maximum portability with the best-in-class 1:1 short-throw ratio.
HDMI/MHL port ensures compatibility with a variety of sources, USB port for charging only. Built-in ASUS Sonic Master enhanced-speaker for authentic sound reproduction

To connect with iPhone/iPad(Lightning port only), purchase separately the Lightning Digital AV Adapter from Apple. To connect with Samsung devices, purchase separately a Samsung specific MHL cable(5 pin to 11 pin) for video output.
